nodes.bodyText:
Not the code change of this PR. But eventHubName might mislead users. It can be either an eventhub or servicebus it's it's an azure-core class.
And EntityPath is optional in the endpoint.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -21,6 +29,8 @@
     private static final String ERROR_MESSAGE_FORMAT = "Could not parse 'connectionString'. Expected format: "
         + "'Endpoint={endpoint};SharedAccessKeyName={sharedAccessKeyName};"
         + "SharedAccessKey={sharedAccessKey};EntityPath={eventHubName}'. Actual: %s";

nodes.bodyText: entityPath is common across both. I will use that.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -21,6 +29,8 @@
     private static final String ERROR_MESSAGE_FORMAT = "Could not parse 'connectionString'. Expected format: "
         + "'Endpoint={endpoint};SharedAccessKeyName={sharedAccessKeyName};"
         + "SharedAccessKey={sharedAccessKey};EntityPath={eventHubName}'. Actual: %s";

nodes.bodyText: "no scheme". This has no impact to any users. So is this considered a "change log"?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,6 +1,7 @@
 # Release History
 
 ## 5.2.0-beta.3 (Unreleased)
+- Default scheme to 'sb://' if not scheme is set in 'Endpoint'.

nodes.bodyText: User do not have to change any API. But surfacing what we change, will give visibility to user when they are looking through changelog related to scheme.
nodes.diffHunk:
